name: tungsten carbide powder production | tungsten carbide powder | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/22501/documentation

This dataset is based on a published inventory representing Chinese tungsten carbide production (Ma et al.,2017). No direct emissions are reported in this inventory and thus direct emission were taken from a publishes inventory by Furberg et al. (2019) which represents tungsten carbide production outside of China assuming that direct emissions are roughly the same. Specific information on the technology used for Chinese tungsten carbide production were not available in the publication by Ma et al. (2017) and thus it is assumed that the process is similar to the one described in the global dataset. Due to this lack of information the reasons for the differences in energy consumption and different inputs of gases (N2 vs H2, in the Chines and global dataset, respectively) remains unclear. ;Furberg, A., Arvidsson, R., Molander, S., 2019. Environmental life cycle assessment of cemented carbide (WC-Co) production. J. Clean. Prod. 209, 1126–1138. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.jclepro.2018.10.272;;;2017, Ma X., Qi C., Ye L., Yang D., Hong J., Life cycle assessment of tungsten carbide powder production: A case study in China, Journal of Cleaner Production, 149, 936-944, 1 - Article

The activity starts when the raw material enters the process

This activity ends with the production of 1 Kg WC-powder
category: C:Manufacturing/24:Manufacture of basic metals/242:Manufacture of basic precious and other non-ferrous metals/2420:Manufacture of basic precious and other non-ferrous metals

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: This dataset represent tungsten carbide powder production in China. The dataset is based on a published inventory by Ma et al. (2017) which represents tungsten mining and tungsten carbide sites located in Jiangsu (CN) and Jiangxi Province (CN), respectively. It is unclear how many productions sites were taken into account for this study. Annual tungsten mining and tungsten carbide production capacities were reported to be  5.0 *10^5 and 1.5 _*10^3 t, respectively in 2014.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: It is assumed that the technology is identical to the one described in the global dataset with the ex-ception of the use of N2 gas instead of H2 gas. ;Furberg, A., Arvidsson, R., Molander, S., 2019. Environmental life cycle assessment of cemented carbide (WC-Co) production. J. Clean. Prod. 209, 1126–1138. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.jclepro.2018.10.272
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Emission of ammonia and carbon dioxide are copied from the global data set.
